text:
Sorry I didn't realize I wrote a while damn book until I went to the publish page haha just give it a chance and hope to hear from you!

(Sigh) ok..to get to the point I'm looking for new friends (obviously) ha there's nothing wrong with the girl friends I have now, we're just at a point in our lives where we're growing apart, and as unfortunate as that may be, it's life. 

Ill be graduating college this May (whoop whoop) and recently got a job working in uptown Dallas. Me and my boyfriend live together in Frisco, we have our own cars and our own schedules. He is my bestfriend!, but I'm definitely missing the female connection/understanding. 
I'm outgoing(when I want to be) and active. I kickbox and even train a class. I love movies, horror or psychology mind fcks to be exact ha so I do a lot of Netflix and chilling, literally, but I want to do so much more. I love being outdoors and doing outdoor activities (except in winter ha I absolutely hate the cold). Happy hour would have to be my favorite hour(half price drinks and food, why the hell not). Not much of a club person, it's rare. I have a freakishly excited pup so if you don't like or are afraid of dogs sorry this probably won't work. 
I don't smoke the green or do drugs and would prefer if you Didn't, but I do have a hookah. 
I plan to travel a lot this year, already have two trips booked (LA and Colorado), so I hope that's on your agenda as well. I don't have snapchat and use my Facebook and Instagram on occasion, I like to enjoy the moment while I have it and not post about it. 

Please have your own car and money to spend, I'm nobody's taxi or handout. Be near me because I know neither one of us will want to drive across the world to hang out. You don't have to be oober fit but at least able to keep up if we go for a 3 mile run, hiking, or even do one of my kickboxing classes. Have a fun personality but chill all at the same time ha. I know we're all adults here so we work for a living just have time to hang once a week or so.

title: Fast cars and smoke
text:
Hi. I am 27 and stuck in an endless loop of routine. My only escape is fast cars, ending my night with some smoke. No, I don't want or need to get into your pants, I could even be preliminarily friend-zoned. Why? I am married. She buries herself in her phone, and I bury my head into my work. title: How do adults make friends?!

So, really. I think everyone around my age in Dallas has friends from HS, college, or work. I didn't go to school here and my coworkers are all quite a bit older. How are you supposed to meet people? Time to check out CL! 

I'm 28 (white, but doesn't matter to me, and if you care, move along, racists) with my own place and car and a good job. Can keep me busy during the week, but free weekends. I love to travel and do that when I can.I don't smoke or do drugs. Yeah, boring, right? ?? Love a good vodka tonic though. 

I love to go out to eat and drink at cheaper bars. None of those $15 martinis for me. I have a sweet tooth and would happily go for a cupcake anytime. I like to go to the movies and watch football. I like to play volleyball and would love to get back into tennis...it's only been like 12 years. I love Disney and Harry Potter and nerd out about both of those. My favorite TV shows are The Office/30 Rock/Parks and Rec types. I guess I'm searching for someone similar, that would like to try new places to eat or check out museums. Preferably around my age, 25-35 and also with a college degree and self supportive. I'm single, no kids, and looking for someone that is just them or them + a S.O. Not a super big fan of children, sry. I get my baby fix from Facebook, thanks. 

I guess email me with some info about yourself! Please spell correctly and use correct punctuation; I am kind of a stickler. I live in North Dallas, so looking for someone nearby. Sorry, not driving out to FW for happy hour after work. 

Not looking for a hookup or anything romantic, just a new friend in a very clique-y city!

title: Something to Think About...
text:
Many people will walk in and out of your life,
but only true friends
will leave footprints in your heart.
To handle yourself, use your head;
To handle others, use your heart.
Anger is only one letter short of danger.
If someone betrays you once, it's his fault;
if he betrays you twice, it's your fault.
Great minds discuss ideas;
Average minds discuss events;
Small minds discuss people.
God gives every bird it's food,
But he does not throw it into it's nest.
He who loses money, loses much;
He who loses a friend, loses more;
He who loses faith, loses all.
Beautiful young people are accidents of nature,
But beautiful old people are works of art.
Learn from the mistakes of others.
You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
The tongue weighs practically nothing,
But so few people can hold it.

title: Saturday Night Life
text:
We all know it's Saturday because we have been looking forward to this weekend since Tuesday. We have worked all week to enjoy the weekend and yet here it is, and we don't have any plans. 

You're reading countless ads because your friends are all busy, or boring, or doing something with other couples. You want to do something, you want to have some fun ...but what?

Your friends can't understand why you don't have a boyfriend or why you aren't married. You're good looking, take care of yourself, intelligent, you don't need a man to complete you, and have a positive attitude and energy. Your typical response to them is that your busy but the truth is that you're picky, have standards, and there aren't good looking, eligible single men worthy of your company. 

Well if this is a fitting description of yourself, then you're reading an ad from someone who is your equal. So while we both contemplate what each of us should do tonight, I would like to suggest that a well written response is all that separates us from spending another boring and uneventful Saturday night.

I am open to a movie, or dinner, or drinks. As a matter of fact, I am open to anything that gets us out of the house. Yes it's raining outside and the skies are cloudy, so let's find a way to salvage the day and enjoy some Saturday night life. 

So I challenge you to take a moment to tell me something about you. I should have added that I don't like drama and mind games so let's not spend the rest of the day emailing back and forth.

text:
I guess I don't really know what I want, which is a turnoff usually...I know it is for me most times...but I find myself in an odd place and just needing companionship more than anything. I have recently moved back to the area after graduate school and working abroad. Both my personal and professional lives seem to be in the toilet at the moment, so I'm just sort of drudging through the days and hoping for something to change. Maybe you can be that something..?

I know I'm not looking for a hookup, and although I'm certainly open to something long term, it's not really my focus right now. I just need...a distraction. I'd love to find someone that I can connect with, and that I look forward to hearing from each day. Maybe even send some happy texts and speak on the phone if things start warming up.

I want to preface that I am unattached and wish that you be as well. The last thing I need is some guy trying to ''explore'' things outside of his relationship. I'd also prefer that you be around my age...or a bit older...and a gentleman.

So if you're up for chatting with a beautiful, kind, smart, fun, and funny lady, then please email me back. Intellectual connection is HUGE with me, so responses of "hey baby", pics of your junk, and/or copying and pasting your spiel that you plaster CL with daily with be deleted immediately.

title: Men Who Are Too Gentle to Live Among Wolves
text:
Men who are too gentle to live among wolves. 
by James Kavanaugh 

My lifestyle is born in my heart, born in the pain of ending one life and beginning another, born in the excitement of the continuing search for life's meaning. Some people do not have to search, they find their niche early in life and rest there, seemingly content and resigned. They don't seem to ask much of life, sometimes they don't seem to take it seriously. At times I envy them, but usually I do not understand them. Seldom do they ever understand me. 

I am one of the searchers. There are, I believe, millions of us. We are not unhappy, but neither are we really content. We continue to explore life, hoping to uncover its ultimate secret. We like to walk along the beach, we are drawn in by the ocean, taken in by its power, its unceasing motion, its mystery and unspeakable beauty. We like forests, mountains, deserts, hidden rivers and the lonely cities as well. Our sadness is as much a part of our lives as is our laughter. To share our sadness with one we love is perhaps as great a joy as we can know 

We searchers are ambitious only for life itself, for everything beautiful it can provide. Most of all we want love, and to be loved. We want to live in a relationship that will not impede our wandering nor prevent our search, nor lock us in prison walls; that will take us for what little we have to give. We do not want to prove ourselves to another or compete for love. My lifestyle is for wanderers, dreamers and lovers for lonely men and women, who dare to ask of life EVERYTHING GOOD and BEAUTIFUL. It is for those who are too gentle to live among wolves.

If you have read this far then you are for real. Some times in life it becomes necessary to put ones wants and needs aside for the benefit of others. I have done this faithfully and now must do more for me. If you are also in a committed relationship and can't/won't leave, lets talk! This isn't about a physical relationship. This is about a mental connection first and foremost.

Good Luck and Best Wishes to You All!

title: Email/Voice Friend
text:
I'm out of the country for now and need an intellectual and emotional connection to home--only one. If you're fun, intelligent or smart and feel kindly towards people please read on, I'm all of that and more.

I am not lonely, just recently chose to be alone. Age nor race matter but English language skills do; articulation and an ease with writing does matter; the hope is that you enjoy language and the 'epistolary' art of letter writing. 

I'm older and you might want to be, too, but it's not a deal breaker as all age is relative. Kik is OK but only after a significant relationship occurs and one liners between emails can work. I also have a U.S VoIP number (but Skype is better with or without video), again, whenever that might become appropriate. I'm in the U.S. East Coast time Zone.

I trust you're passionate about your interests and life choices, please tell me of one? I was (still am, I suppose) an offshore sailor. I love the arts, museums, opera and even ballet (esp. Alvin Ailey). All are cool, but live theater is my favorite.

Be respectful and tolerant and while witty cynicism goes a long way to communicate and entertain, please don't be someone who has brought it home as a permanent guest and extols it as an endearing personality characteristic--it's not. 

The phrase that best describes me is a 'renaissance type.' I've traveled, sailed and done corporate startups; I've seen much and done a lot which hopefully means I'm entertaining.

You should be an avid social and political observer and as you follow silly season events like national debates please be one who rejects those who cannot articulate a paragraph much less a complete sentence, however entertaining 'he' might be. [We can discuss the virtue of tolerance later.]

Thank you if you've read this far; if you do respond please put the name of your favorite literary heroine in the subject line? For example, Lady Macbeth or Madame Bovary (well, let's hope neither of them).
